metadata.Title: CVE-2012-5526 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
CGI.pm module before 3.63 for Perl does not properly escape newlines in (1) Set-Cookie or (2) P3P headers, which might allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary headers into responses from applications that use CGI.pm.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcgi-pm-perl - 3.64-1
No subscription required

libcgi-fast-perl - 5.14.2-16
libperl5.18 - 5.14.2-16
perl - 5.14.2-16
perl-base - 5.14.2-16
perl-debug - 5.14.2-16
perl-modules - 5.14.2-16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcgi-pm-perl package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.64-1').
perl package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.14.2-16').
